title: 'It's time to cool it down,' Biden tells a nation in shock
summary: Joe Biden tells Americans this year's presidential election would be a 'time of testing', as he seeks to lower the temperature following the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.

title: Trump assassination attempt: What we know about how it unfolded and the shooter
summary: The FBI identified the shooter as Thomas Matthew Crooks, a 20-year-old from Pennsylvania's Bethel Park.

title: Euro 2024: Spain beats England 2-1 and wins record fourth European Championship title
summary: A deserving Roja dominated the Three Lions in Berlin, denying England its first title win in nearly 60 years.

title: Watch: Olympic torch arrives in Paris
summary: From Sunday until Monday evening, the flame will travel throughout the capital. Its journey began on the Champs-Elysées, in the hands of football star Thierry Henry.

title: Rwanda's Paul Kagame, criticized abroad but undisputed favorite in presidential election
summary: After ousting two of his opponents, the Rwandan president will go before the electorate once again on July 15. All-powerful in Kigali, he is under fire internationally for his support of the Congolese M23 rebels.

title: The Sunflowers Case: The petty criminal, the attempted assassination and the shadow cast by Iran
summary: On November 9 last year, Spanish political leader Alejo Vidal-Quadras escaped an assassination attempt in broad daylight in Madrid. He immediately accused the Iranian regime. The chief suspect, a man from greater Paris, was arrested in the Netherlands on June 6.

title: French left back to square one as proposed PM 'declines' role
summary: Huguette Bello, who was backed by the Communists and La France Insoumise, crucially did not have the support of the Socialists.

title: World leaders react to Trump assassination attempt
summary: Leaders wished Donald Trump a speedy victory and condemned political violence.

title: Watch: Moment shooter attempts to assassinate Donald Trump at Pennsylvania campaign rally
summary: The former US president and Republican presidential candidate was shot at during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday. The shooter and an attendee were killed, and two bystanders were seriously wounded.

title: Lamine Yamal, the 17-year-old new symbol of Spain
summary: The young winger embodies the revival of the Spanish national team, which is aiming for a fourth continental success against England in Sunday's Euro 2024 final.

title: Wimbledon: Alcaraz beats Djokovic in three sets to retain title
summary: Carlos Alcaraz defeated Novak Djokovic 6-2, 6-2, 7-6 in a rematch of last year's final.

title: Tour de France: Pogacar pulverizes opposition in third stage win
summary: Jonas Vingegaard lost another 1min 8sec to the race leader, and third-placed Remco Evenepoel lost 2min 51sec.

title: The Bear Brigade, the Kremlin's new paramilitary outfit in Africa
summary: Since Yevgeny Prigozhin's death on August 23, 2023, the Russian Ministry of Defense has taken over the Wagner Group's activities in Africa. Among the many paramilitary units it supervises is the Bear Brigade, whose men made a conspicuous arrival in Burkina Faso.

title: Renault, the new official car of the French presidency
summary: For Bastille Day on Sunday, French President Emmanuel Macron traveled across Paris in the Renault Rafale, the new presidential car.

title: Russia hit by gigantic forest fires amid official indifference
summary: In Siberia and the Russian Far East, a million hectares of forest are being ravaged by flames. Since the beginning of the year, fires have destroyed an area the size of Normandy. Regulations and public management are being questioned.

title: François Hollande and his actress wife were at a café. Does anyone care?
summary: After a trip to the polling booth on July 7, former president François Hollande and his wife Julie Gayet enjoyed their Sunday in downtown Tulle, Corrèze – waiting for victory and looking in the same direction together.

title: Jegou-Auradou case: the background to the indictment of the rugby players accused of "aggravated rape" in Argentina
summary: The two French national team players remain in pre-trial detention in Mendoza, where they have chosen not to make any statement. They are still proclaiming their innocence in a case where two versions of the story contradict each other.

title: The Paris 2024 Olympics and the promises of a new Seine
summary: Massive investments have been made to restore the river that flows through Paris to its former glory and functions, both in preparation for the Olympic and Paralympic Games and to comply with the European Water Framework Directive adopted in 2000.

title: France's startups concerned over effects of Macron's snap elections
summary: The French FinTech community, strongly backed by French President Emmanuel Macron, is worried about the changing image of the country and its president among foreign investors.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu's financial war against the Palestinian Authority
summary: The Israeli government is financially crippling the Palestinian Authority by withholding revenues that should be automatically transferred to it.

title: One year after its reopening, the National Museum of the History of Immigration is drawing crowds in Paris
summary: The Parisian institution, which took a stand against the far right during the parliamentary elections, saw a dramatic increase in visitors in 2023 but remains underfunded.

title: China awaits new impulse
summary: The third plenum of the Communist Party, which opens on Monday, will determine whether President Xi Jinping is ready to launch new reforms in a gloomy economic climate.

title: Five dead in Mogadishu cafe bombing during Euro final
summary: The popular restaurant was crowded with football fans watching England take on Spain in the Euro 2024 final.

title: Far-right RN carries out discreet purge after electoral failure
summary: The Rassemblement National has dismissed several members who proved to be xenophobic, racist or anti-Semitic during the election campaign.

title: Dozens dead in DR Congo clashes
summary: The village of Kinsele, where the clashes happened, is in an area which has seen a resurgence of violence in recent days.

title: French military intelligence is worried about increasing foreign interference
summary: The French Defense Intelligence and Security Directorate published a report revealing the rise in attempted intrusions or approaches by foreign states, targeting France's economic sphere and companies in the defense sector.

title: Rwanda's presidential election is a foregone conclusion
summary: Paul Kagame, who has been at the country's helm for 30 years, is certain of re-election and could remain in power until 2034 following a constitutional revision in 2015.

title: Civilian kidnappings in Chad: 'You can thank your friends, they're the ones who betrayed you!'
summary: The population and NGOs who are present in the south-west of the country, a neglected region where kidnappings for ransom are frequent, suspect the complicity of the law enforcement agencies.

title: After shots fired at Trump, calls for unity in a fractured nation as Republican convention begins
summary: The former president and candidate in the November election is in Milwaukee for the RNC, where Republican delegates are due to nominate him. Already undisputed within the party, he is now in the spotlight for his reaction following Saturday's attack.

title: Euro 2024: Spain, the tournament's most enjoyable team, beats England to lift trophy
summary: La Roja won the final (2-1) on Sunday, showcasing the most polished gameplay seen this summer. The Spanish team has now won a record fourth continental title.

title: Trump assassination attempt: Le Monde's former correspondent answers readers' questions
summary: Gilles Paris is a Le Monde columnist and a former correspondent in Washington. He answered questions from our readers following the attempted assassination of ex-US president Donald Trump on Saturday.

title: Gaza: Dozens of civilians killed in Israeli strikes targeting Hamas officials
summary: Israel carried out a particularly deadly attack in the Gaza Strip on July 13. A Hamas leader was slain. At least 90 people were killed and 300 wounded in a zone designated as 'humanitarian' by Israeli authorities.

title: Euro 2024: Spaniards celebrate national team's continental triumph
summary: Euphoric fans celebrated Spain's victory over England late into the night, won over by the freshness and beauty of their new national team's performance.
